data.text: Any Experience With Dyna Plug Kits?

Does anyone have experience with dyna plug kits? I am looking for a dedicated plug kit for the gravel bike. I like the idea of the dyna plugs but the sharp point looks like it would get into the rim tape.

I never had a good experience with plugs... they kept being expelled out by the air. That said, in my last experience I almost tried a Stan's Dart, but decided to patch the tire from inside and buy new tires just in case... (I will need them anyway). But I still need to find something to use mid ride. This time I could walk the bike back home.
data.author: Andre Velloso
Andre Velloso

data.text: that‚Äôs a big stick lol
data.author: Taylor Evans

data.text: Yes, I should have left it inside and pumped CO2 in the tire... I could probably made back to home.
data.author: Andre Velloso

data.text: Great when they work, frustrating when they do not. I have had the best luck w bacon strips.
data.author: Jason Holzworth

data.text: Chris Bussiere have a recommended kit? Mine for mtb is massive. They are almost car size
data.author: Taylor Evans

data.text:
Genuine Innovations Tubeless Tackle Kit https://a.co/d/brLS9CS I like that kit because you get a valve core remover built in, valve cores, it‚Äôs small and compact. And you can buy bacon strip refills. I also have Stan‚Äôs dart. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn‚Äôt. I used the bacon strips to plug a car tire üò≥üò≥. It worked.

data.text: I have it. Would not recommend. Much harder to use than you'd expect. I actually prefer my simple 'bacon' insert kit (which is way cheaper).

data.text: Awesomely good design
data.author: Jock DeBoer

data.text: Hands down, Stans Darts! Nothing works as well, super easy, can‚Äôt mess it up, seals the biggest holes with one plug, very light applicator/storage/spare tool! üêç
data.author: Mark Jake Jacobson

data.text: I'm glad it works for you but I couldn't disagree more. I've broken off two Darts on basic punctures. They're great if you have a hole you can poke a finger through, but the small bleeders don't have enough room for the weak plastic Dart shaft to enter the puncture. The steel shaft of the Dynaplug kits easily enter the tire, and the Megaplug in the Racer can plug just about anything that you're going to fix roadside. So a regular plug for a smaller hole, Megaplug for a larger one.
data.author: Ted Redmer

data.text: my sealant takes care of the small ones never had a problem before üòâÔøº
data.author: Mark Jake Jacobson

data.text: I had one that even Orange Seal Endurance couldn't quite seal, it was an odd shape I think. I broke off two Darts just trying to get it started in the hole, said a few bad words, and pedaled faster to get home before I was riding rim lol.
data.author: Ted Redmer

data.text:
I use this one. I bought a few. It has two sizes of bacon strips and everything is really well thought out. https://a.co/4cU3ENT

data.author: Jess Campbell

data.text: I've successfully used the Dynaplug and Dart... I like both of them. Have one in my tubless road saddle bag and the other in my gravel saddle bag.
data.author: Steve Heintzelman

data.text: I have used my Dyna Plug kit successfully a couple times.
data.author: Brent Davis

data.text: I carry the bacon strips. I‚Äôve always wondered weather the metal tip of a Dynaplug could damage a carbon rim if the tire gets compressed.
data.author: David Watson

data.text: I was sold when I was able to patch a bead puncture on a skinwall WTB Resolute, which if you're familiar are paper thin on the sidewalls. Held the rest of an 80 mile ride and for a few more weeks without a leak before I replaced the tire to be safe.
data.author: Ted Redmer

data.text: if you think those are thin you should see the 374g, 29 x 2.0‚Äù Furious Freds üòâ
data.author: Mark Jake Jacobson

data.text: I love Dyna Plug! They‚Äôve saved several rides between myself and my wife. First time was my wife‚Äôs bike at the top of a 15 mile downhill! Held air perfectly! Even big holes, just stuff a couple plugs in! I like the pill because you can carry 4 plugs. Race can only carry 2.
data.author: Bryan Tucker

data.text: I used a small rubber fishing worm once and it got me home perfectly.
data.author: Andrew Yee

data.text: Yes. They are great. Wouldn't want to use anything else by now. They saved me a few times.
data.author: Xaver von Treyer

data.text: Stans darts are best for gravel bikes
data.author: Sergio Armani

data.text: I carry the dyna plug race and the one time I had to use it - worked perfectly.
data.author: Larry Narachi

data.text: I have used them with great success and no damage to rim tape or rim. My problem Is getting the refill plugs in Canada any where else other than Amazon where they are priced sky high.
data.author: Zac Wheeler
